headline: METROPOLITAN HANDICAP WON BY ORMESDALE ON BELMONT PARK'S OPENING DAY; ORMESDALE TAKES THE METROPOLITAN R. T. Wilson, Jr.'s, Colt Gallops Home Four Lengths in Front of Spur, the Favorite. LARGE CROWD SEES RACES About 10,000 Spectators at Opening Day of Belmont Park Meeting Despite Gloomy Weather. Stromboll Is Withdrawn. Enthusiasm Is High. Practice Spins Are Light. Spur Gains Ground. FASHION DISPLAY LACKING. Society Largely Represented, but Gay Styles Are Missing.

headline: PLOTTERS HERE AGAINST DRAFT UNDER WATCH; Federal Authorities Discover the Trail of Anarchist Agitators Against Conscription. EMMA GOLDMAN IS ACTIVE 15,000 Letters Sent Assailing "Patriotic Claptrap" Meant to "Prussianize America." GREGORY ORDERS ACTION Instructs Attorneys and Marshals to Seize and Prosecute Offenders. "Patriotic Claptrap." Emma Goldman Prophesies. Federal Authorities Prepared. 'No-Conscription' Agitator Arrested. WILL PROTECT OFFICIALS. Attorney General Orders Arrest of Persons Blocking the Draft. WOULD ENJOIN THE DRAFT. Suit Filed in Kansas City;-Plot in Central West. EXPECT EASY REGISTRATION. Party Organizations Have Prepared Men of Draft Age for Their Duty. POLICE AT PACIFIST MEETING. Peace Conference Will Also Be Watched by Federal Agents. HUNT DATES TO ESCAPE DRAFT Naturalized Citizens Prevented from Changing Birth Records. MUST REGISTER UP TO 31. Provost Marshal Holds That Is the Intent of the Draft Law. DRAFT LAW CAUSES RIOT. Rival Forces Clash in Toledo and Several Are Hurt.

headline: CUT IN FOOD PRICES IS TO BE HOOVER'S FIRST OFFICIAL AIM; Ready to Begin Fight on High Cost of Living the Moment Congress Gives Him Power. HOPES TO END SPECULATION Shortening the Chain Between Producer and Consumer the Basis of His Plan. ARMY OF EXPERTS AT HAND Food Administrator to Have the Volunteer Assistance of Specialists in All Lines. President's Order Supreme. No Drastic Food Survey. CUT IN FOOD PRICES HOOVER'S FIRST AIM To Proceed With Caution. Offers of Free Service. FOOD BILL ADVANCED. Senate Committee Substitutes Measure Passed by the House. BEER MAY FALL UNDER BAN.
